As much as it sucked that it took me around a week to download BB Rage, you have to realize that BB repacks. They don't rip. I'd rather take the hit of a few extra gigs then to download a Kaos file with down-sized video that has been compressed/re-encoded. And it ain't easy. I'm in the same boat with downloads as probably everyone here. Often times I get only 40-50 kb/s on heavily leeches files. So yeah, 11+ Gib of BB Rage took me quite a while. From what I've seen though, I'm not sure Rage contains that much video. It's remarkably similar to Borderlands.

Okay, here is my feedback:

I can save totally fine, I can change video settings totally fine. Game is good.

I did experience the crash when you first have to take photos of TK, so I reloaded and simply didn't take any photos at that point. Game continued just fine afterwards.

Some of the intro cutscenes also don't seem to play but they did the 2nd time I tried. Really weird but not that annoying tbh.

Now I'm in the mall and everything plays ok.

Thanx Kaos, + 1

If youâre on Windows 7, there could be a solution for you: Go to: Control Panel -> Sound -> Speakers -> Advanced. there, Try decreasing your sound quality to 24 bit, 48000 Hz. solved the problem to lots of people. Capcom games seem to have problems with audio quality, not sure about how much it affects the game itself. think this is also applicable on vista.
